title: Woman arrested after boy accidentally shoots himself in Terrytown
content:
(NOLA.com | The Times-Picayune file)
Authorities arrested a woman who was supposed to be supervising a 9-year-old boy when he accidentally shot himself in the leg in Terrytown on Tuesday evening (Sept. 13), a Jefferson Parish Sheriff's Office arrest report said.
Elina Joseph, 50, of 2148 Esplanade Place, was booked with child desertion, Authorities have not clarified whether Joseph is related to the boy.
Investigators determined she left the 9-year-old and his cousin, 10, at her home while she went to handle some paperwork at her daughter's school, the report said. While Joseph was away, the 9-year-old found a pistol inside the house.
The gun discharged as the boy was handling it, striking him leg. He was taken to University Medical Center in New Orleans where he is expected to recover, Col. John Fortunato, spokesman for the Sheriff's Office has said.
The 10-year-old was not injured.
Joseph was taken into custody at her residence and booked into the Jefferson Parish Correctional Center. No bond information was available Wednesday.
